opposite_reasoning: PeaceProcess is the strongest choice because: (1) It has high opposition strength (military action vs peace-building), (2) It likely exists in both WordNet and SUMO ontologies, making it readily available, (3) It has exceptional steering utility for AI safety - distinguishing military/conflict escalation from diplomatic/peace efforts is crucial for monitoring harmful content and strategic deception, (4) It represents a meaningful semantic axis that captures war↔peace opposition at the process level. While CivilianProcess has slightly higher opposition strength theoretically, PeaceProcess is more likely to exist in standard ontologies and provides clearer semantic boundaries for Fisher-LDA.
